title: Dumbrava Sibiului Natural Park
text:
The Dumbrava Sibiului Natural Park () (<a href="nature%20park">natural park</a> category V <a href="IUCN">IUCN</a>) is a <a href="protected%20area">protected area</a> situated in central <a href="Romania">Romania</a>, in <a href="Sibiu%20County">Sibiu County</a>, in administrative territory of <a href="Sibiu">Sibiu</a> city.
Description.
Dumbrava Sibiului Natural Park was declared a natural protected area by Law Number 5, of March 6, 2000. It consists of a forest area ("Dumbrava Forest") crossed by the <a href="Trinkbach%20River">Trinkbach River</a>, forming on its course three <a href="wikt%3Aanthropic">anthropic</a>-type lakes. 
The natural park was a favoured promenade location for inhabitants of Sibiu as early as the 18th century. It is known nowadays for the <a href="ASTRA%20National%20Museum%20Complex">ASTRA National Museum Complex</a>. The defunct tram line connecting Sibiu with Rasinari can also be seen from there. The Municipal Cemetery, opened in 1907, is located on the south side of the park's woods.
Flora and fauna.
Forest vegetation.
Species of <a href="tree">tree</a>s: <a href="English%20oak">English oak</a> ("Quercus robur"), <a href="Quercus%20petraea">sessile oak</a> ("Quercus petraea"), <a href="Carpinus%20betulus">European hornbeam</a> ("Carpinus betulus"), <a href="elm">elm</a> ("Ulmus"), <a href="Acer%20campestre">field maple</a> ("Acer campestre"), <a href="Fagus%20sylvatica">European beech</a> ("Fagus sylvatica"), <a href="Tilia">linden</a> ("Tilia"), <a href="pine">pine</a> ("Pinus");
Species of <a href="shrub">shrub</a>s: <a href="Crataegus%20monogyna">common hawthorn</a>, <a href="Ligustrum%20vulgare">common privet</a> ("Ligustrum vulgare"), <a href="Rosa%20canina">dog rose</a> ("Rosa canina"), <a href="Rhamnus%20frangula">alder buckthorn</a> ("Rhamnus frangula"), <a href="Prunus%20spinosa">blackthorn</a> ("Prunus spinosa").
Species of grass: <a href="Epilobium%20hirsutum">great willowherb</a> ("Epilobium hirstum"), <a href="Lactuca%20muralis">wall lettuce</a> ("Lactuca muralis"), <a href="Silene%20dioica">red campion</a> ("Melandium rubrum"), <a href="Colchicum%20autumnale">autumn crocus</a> ("Colchicum autumnale").
Fauna.
Species of <a href="mammal">mammal</a>s: <a href="roe%20deer">roe deer</a> ("Capreolus capreolus"), <a href="fox">fox</a> ("Vulpes vulpes"), <a href="wild%20boar">wild boar</a> ("Sus scrofa"), <a href="squirrel">squirrel</a> ("Sciurus carolinensis");
Species of <a href="bird">bird</a>s: <a href="Old%20World%20sparrow">sparrow</a> (in family "Emberizidae"), <a href="Eurasian%20jay">Eurasian jay</a> ("Garrulus glandarius"), <a href="Picinae">woodpecker</a> (family "<a href="Picidae">Picidae</a>"), <a href="Common%20blackbird">blackbird</a> ("Turdus merula"), <a href="common%20chaffinch">common chaffinch</a> ("Fringilla coelebs"), <a href="European%20turtle%20dove">turtle dove</a> ("Streptopelia turtur"), <a href="common%20raven">common raven</a> ("Corvus corax"), <a href="common%20cuckoo">common cuckoo</a> ("Cuculus canorus").
